name: jatropha seed production | jatropha seed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4403/documentation

This dataset represents the production of Jatropha curcas L. seeds. All the exchanges are calculated per kg of jatropha seeds (wet mass) and are mainly based on field data from India and literature values. The economic life span of a jatropha plantation is assumed to be 20 years, with an average annual productivity of 2.5 tons of seeds per hectare. The inventory includes the use of mineral and organic fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation, machinery, field emissions from the fertilizer and pesticide application and land use changes.

From preparing the land and planting of Jatropha curcas.


This dataset ends with the harvesting of jatropha curcas seeds and includes the land preparation and the crop management (fertilizers, pesticides, and machinery). The application of pesticides and fertilizers, as well as the harvesting of jatropha seeds is done manually.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The global dataset was extrapolated from a typical large-scale Jatropha cultivation system from India. The extrapolation from India was chosen, since 80% of the total land under Jatropha cultivation is located in India (GEXSI, 2009).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Field data. The global dataset is approximated by field data from agronomic trials in India. Randomized block design (spacing of 3m x 3m) was used for experimental set-up. The inventory data was mainly built based on the field data, which are validated and if necessary complemented by literature data (e.g. land transformation).

flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of "jatropha seed" is calculated to be circa 2.43E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: "phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5", "potassium chloride, as K2O", "urea, as N". The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.86E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature. The gross energy is calculated using following formula; gross energy (MJ) = crude protein (kg)*23.04 (MJ/kg)+crude fat (kg)*38.96 (MJ/kg)+crude fibre (kg)*17.95 (MJ/kg)+carbohydrates (kg)*17.17 (MJ/kg) (formula based on expert opinion, cross referenced; Diepenbrock, 2012, Energy Balance in Crop Production). The product composition of fruits and vegetables is extracted from literature (Martinez-Herrera, j., 2006, Chemical composition, toxic/antimerabolic constituents, and effects of different treatments on their levels, in four provenances of Jatropha curcas L. from Mexico, Food Chemistry).Crude protein (g)= 636.5, crude fat (g)= 7.6, crude fibre (g)= 57, ash (g)= 104.5, water (g)= 50, carbohydrates (g)= 133. The gross energy per kg of DM is 19.23MJ. The calculated gross energy per kg of reference product is thus 18.27MJ.

exchanges.description: Estimation (based on field observations from India): Land preparation activities include land clearing, marking and preparing pits. For land preparation 12 l diesel is consumed per hectare by a small tractors (estimate). The values used for the processes are extrapolated from the diesel use of the datasets (planting: 16.8 kg diesel per ha). Harvesting, fertilizing, pruning and weeding are conducted manually.

exchanges.description: Literature value: The land use change patterns for jatropha is based on the GEXSI report where global inventory data are provided. The global inventory is based on 170 expert interviews of 55 countries and 160 online questionnaires. According to the GEXSI report, 46.2 % of the jatropha plantations were established on former arable land, 48.5% on bare land, 0.3% on primary forest land and 5% on secondary forest land.

exchanges.description: Calculated value: Jatropha plantations are considered as permanent crop. The amount of transformed land is calculated by deviding of the area (1 ha) by the lifetime capacity (lifetime [years] times the average productivity [kg/ha/year]).
